docs.abstract: The Cyber Tire from Pirelli can sense if a car is slipping and warn the driver or the car to make adjustments.
docs.snippet: The Cyber Tire from Pirelli can sense if a car is slipping and warn the driver or the car to make adjustments.
docs.lead_paragraph: This article is part of our continuing Fast Forward series, which examines technological, economic, social and cultural shifts that happen as businesses evolve.

headline.main: High-Tech Tires, From Pit Lane to Your Garage
headline.print_headline: Turn Down the Radio. The Tires Are Talking.

docs.abstract: Apple found renewed growth with an increase in phone sales as well as younger products, like the Apple Watch, AirPods and its subscription services.
docs.snippet: Apple found renewed growth with an increase in phone sales as well as younger products, like the Apple Watch, AirPods and its subscription services.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Apple’s profit grew for the first time in a year with the help of an old friend: the iPhone.

headline.main: New iPhones Fuel Strong Profit for Apple
headline.print_headline: Apple’s Profits Are Up Again, Thanks to Sales Of New iPhones

docs.abstract: Michael Milken was among a “who’s who of white-collar criminals” given official reprieve by President Trump.
docs.snippet: Michael Milken was among a “who’s who of white-collar criminals” given official reprieve by President Trump.
docs.lead_paragraph: Mike Bloomberg will appear onstage for the first time at a Democratic debate tonight, and Senator Elizabeth Warren is ready: “Primary voters curious about how each candidate will take on Donald Trump can get a live demonstration of how we each take on an egomaniac billionaire,” she tweeted. (Want this in your inbox each morning? Sign up here.)

headline.main: A Presidential Pardon for the ‘Junk Bond King’

docs.abstract: The president has reveled in the declines in Americans receiving aid from several government programs in recent years, citing his economic policies as a catalyst.
docs.snippet: The president has reveled in the declines in Americans receiving aid from several government programs in recent years, citing his economic policies as a catalyst.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump likes to claim credit for the number of Americans who have stopped receiving food stamps since he entered office. In July 2018, he said 3.5 million had fallen from the rolls; the next spring, five million had. In his State of the Union speech this month, the number had grown to seven million.

headline.main: Millions of Americans Have Moved Off Assistance. Does Trump Get Credit?
headline.print_headline: Millions Are Off Welfare.  Does Trump Get Credit?

byline.original: By Jim Tankersley and Lola Fadulu

docs.abstract: As central bankers fret about their ability to offset future recessions given already-low rates, they are asking lawmakers to step up.
docs.snippet: As central bankers fret about their ability to offset future recessions given already-low rates, they are asking lawmakers to step up.
docs.lead_paragraph: Federal Reserve officials and top economists have been debating which tools will work best to fight future recessions, and a clear consensus is forming: They are going to need lawmakers’ help.

headline.main: ‘Now Is the Time’: A Fed Official Urges Congress to Plan for Recessions
headline.print_headline: Congress Must Prepare For the Next Recession, A Fed Official Says

docs.abstract: Oil prices climbed again, while stock markets slipped, as the fallout from the U.S. killing of a top Iranian general continues.
docs.snippet: Oil prices climbed again, while stock markets slipped, as the fallout from the U.S. killing of a top Iranian general continues.

headline.main: Why the Markets Are Still Worried About Iran

docs.abstract: As Chinese stocks plunge and health experts worry about a pandemic, analysts increasingly see the Wuhan coronavirus as a huge threat to the global economy.
docs.snippet: As Chinese stocks plunge and health experts worry about a pandemic, analysts increasingly see the Wuhan coronavirus as a huge threat to the global economy.
docs.lead_paragraph: Congrats to the Kansas City Chiefs. The electronic dance music artist DJ-Sol, who moonlights as David Solomon, the C.E.O. of Goldman Sachs, pumped out the beats at a Super Bowl party in Miami over the weekend. More on the ads below. headline.main: Why the New Coronavirus’s Economic Hit Could Be Worse Than SARS

docs.abstract: As the coronavirus hits China’s economy, threatening fuel demand, policymakers are weighing an emergency meeting to discuss cuts to crude output.
docs.snippet: As the coronavirus hits China’s economy, threatening fuel demand, policymakers are weighing an emergency meeting to discuss cuts to crude output.
docs.lead_paragraph: Officials of some of the world’s largest oil producers are scrambling to stem a sharp fall in prices over concerns that the growing coronavirus epidemic will reduce demand from China, the biggest importer.

headline.main: OPEC Scrambles to React to Falling Oil Demand From China
headline.print_headline: OPEC Scrambles to React As Virus Imperils Demand

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries

docs.abstract: China is racing to screen ever more patients in Hubei Province, acknowledging that delays in diagnosing the virus are a major obstacle to controlling the epidemic.
docs.snippet: China is racing to screen ever more patients in Hubei Province, acknowledging that delays in diagnosing the virus are a major obstacle to controlling the epidemic.
docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Zhang Xiaochun, who works in a hospital in Wuhan, was in dismay. Her patient had been running a fever for nine days, and a CT scan showed signs of pneumonia — symptoms of the new coronavirus sweeping across the central Chinese city.

headline.main: As Deaths Mount, China Tries to Speed Up Coronavirus Testing
headline.print_headline: As Deaths Mount, a Race to Screen Ever More Patients to Slow an Epidemic

docs.abstract: The automaker named Jim Farley, its head of strategy, as chief operating officer. He will report to Jim Hackett, the C.E.O.
docs.snippet: The automaker named Jim Farley, its head of strategy, as chief operating officer. He will report to Jim Hackett, the C.E.O.
docs.lead_paragraph: For nearly three years, Jim Hackett has worked to revitalize Ford Motor with a few signs of progress on either the company’s bottom line or its stock price.

headline.main: Ford Shuffles Top Management as It Chases a Turnaround
